data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قِيلَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِيهَا comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: to enter, got in, passed, to penetrate, breach, break through, invade, come upon, visit, intrude, meddle, insert, introduce, to participate/commence/include/take part, it became comprehended/comprised in it, mix/intermingle.. Have intercourse with, go into (one's wife).. Income/revenue/profit.. confused/badness/unsound/corrupt, vice, deceit/guile/circumvention.. A select group of close associates.. A place of entrance, gate, ingoing, instrument allowing entrance, key.. Guest.
data.sentence: The word ادْخُلُوا comes from the root د خ ل and is associated with the meanings: to enter, got in, passed, to penetrate, breach, break through, invade, come upon, visit, intrude, meddle, insert, introduce, to participate/commence/include/take part, it became comprehended/comprised in it, mix/intermingle.. Have intercourse with, go into (one's wife).. Income/revenue/profit.. confused/badness/unsound/corrupt, vice, deceit/guile/circumvention.. A select group of close associates.. A place of entrance, gate, ingoing, instrument allowing entrance, key.. Guest.

data.meanings: To remain/stay/dwell/abode, to remain or continue incessantly/always/endlessly/forever/perpetually, to adorn another with ornaments, to be slow in becoming hoary (when advanced in age), endowed with perpetual vigour
data.sentence: The word خَالِدِينَ comes from the root خ ل د and is associated with the meanings: To remain/stay/dwell/abode, to remain or continue incessantly/always/endlessly/forever/perpetually, to adorn another with ornaments, to be slow in becoming hoary (when advanced in age), endowed with perpetual vigour

data.meanings: Hell or Hell-fire, name of the fire with which GOD will punish in the life to come, proper name of the abode of punishment.
data.sentence: The word جَهَنَّمَ comes from the root ج ه ن م and is associated with the meanings: Hell or Hell-fire, name of the fire with which GOD will punish in the life to come, proper name of the abode of punishment.

data.meanings: to abide in a place, halt, settle in a place, detain anyone (in a place), lodge. mathwa - dwelling, abode, lodging, resort, resting place, stay. thaawin (for thaawiyun) - dweller.
data.sentence: The word مَثْوَى comes from the root ث و ي and is associated with the meanings: to abide in a place, halt, settle in a place, detain anyone (in a place), lodge. mathwa - dwelling, abode, lodging, resort, resting place, stay. thaawin (for thaawiyun) - dweller.

data.meanings: mighty/strong, distress/misfortune/calamity, state of poverty, evil/bad, very evil, feigned lowliness/submissiveness, punishment, state of trial/affliction, courage/valour/prowess.
data.sentence: The word فَبِئْسَ comes from the root ب ا س and is associated with the meanings: mighty/strong, distress/misfortune/calamity, state of poverty, evil/bad, very evil, feigned lowliness/submissiveness, punishment, state of trial/affliction, courage/valour/prowess.
The word أَبْوَابَ comes from the root ب و ب and is associated with the meanings: door/gate, place of entrance, mode/manner.

data.meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
data.sentence: The word الْمُتَكَبِّرِينَ comes from the root ك ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
